autocoop.builder.builder module¶

Builder for COOP attack codes. Author: flxflx / felix.schuster@rub.de

Builder for array-based ML-Gs. The array starts at label LABEL_ARRAY.

class autocoop.builder.builder.Builder(baseBuff, arch=<class autocoop.builder.builder.X64>)[source]¶

Bases: autocoop.builder.builder.BaseBuilder

DEPRECATED example builder used in x64 exploits. Assumes that object pointer array is travsersed in loop gadget. The object pointer array is put at the very beginning of the created buffer.

finalize(maxOffset)[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

class autocoop.builder.builder.LinkedListBuilder(baseBuff, offsetPtrObj, offsetPtrNext, mainObj, arch)[source]¶

Bases: autocoop.builder.builder.BaseBuilder

Builder for linked list-based ML-Gs. The first linked list item is labeled with LABEL_BASE_LL. The first object is labeled with LABEL_BASE_OBJ. Use LABEL_BASE_LL to put a pointer to the first linked list item into your initial object.

LABEL_BASE_LL = 101¶
LABEL_BASE_OBJ = 100¶
class ObjLabels(labelObj, labelLlItem)[source]¶
addObj(obj, linkedList=True, labelNextItem=None, labelItem=None, lastObj=False)[source]¶

Adds an object. @param obj the object to add @param linkedList if false, the object is not put into the linked list. (All regular objects should be put into the linked list.) @param labelNextItem [optional] the label of the next item. @param labelItem [optinal] the label of the current item. @param lastObj [IMPORTANT] is this the last object?

class autocoop.builder.builder.LooplessBuilder(arch, baseBuff, vindexFirst, ptrVtableRecGadget, descriptors)[source]¶

Bases: autocoop.builder.builder.BaseBuilder

Builder for COOP code that does not rely on a conventional ML-G but on a REC-G. An example for a REC-G is the following virtual destructor:

class X {
    A* a; // class A has a virtual destructor
    B* b; // class B has a virtual destructor
    virtual void X::~X() {
        delete a;
        delete b;
    }
};

With “delete a;” the actual vfgadget is invoked, with “delete b;” X::~X() is invoked recursively.

class InvocationDescriptor(vindex, offsetThisPtr)[source]¶

Describes an invocation location in the REC-G. E.g., X::~X() has two invocation locations: a: vindex=<vtable index of A::~A()>, offsetThisPtr=8 b: vindex=<vtable index of B::~B()>, offsetThisPtr=16

LABEL_FIRST_OBJ = 100¶
addObj(obj, ptrVtable)[source]¶

Adds an object. @param obj the object to add. @param ptrVtable address of a vtable entry of the vfgadget to use.

addPointer(offset, value, label=None)[source]¶

Adds an absolute pointer.

addQword(offset, qword=None, label=None)[source]¶
addRegion(region)[source]¶
addUnresolvedPointer(offset, targetLabel, targetOffset=0, label=None)[source]¶

Adds a placeholder for a pointer to a certain label. Example: if your gadget has the following semantics: “dword ptr [dword ptr [ecx+10h]+28h] => 5” then chossing offset=0x10, targetOffset=-0x28 and label=XYZ would write the value 5 to the address labeld XYZ.

@param offset Offset from the beginning of the object in bytes. @param targetLabel The label the yet to-be-resolved pointer should point to. @paran targetOffset [optional] The offset from the target label the yet to-be-resolved pointer should point to. @param label [optional] A unique global label for this pointer.

addWord(offset, word=None, label=None)[source]¶

autocoop.builder.exp_chrome64_0.build(baseChrome, baseBuff, maxOffset)[source]¶

Invokes system(‘bin/sh’). @param baseChrome Base address of the chrome binary. @param r relocator for the chrome binary. @param baseBuff Base address of buffer under control. @param maxOffset Size of buffer under control.

autocoop.builder.exp_chrome64_1 module¶

class autocoop.builder.exp_chrome64_1.LABEL[source]¶
PTR_ABORT = 0¶
PTR_SYSTEM = 1¶
STR_BIN_SH = 2¶
autocoop.builder.exp_chrome64_1.build(baseChrome, baseBuff, maxOffset)[source]¶

Creates loopless COOP code for Chrome that invokes system(‘bin/sh’). Loopless COOP code recursively invokes a REC-G and does not require an ML-G. @param baseChrome Base address of the chrome binary. @param baseBuff Base address of buffer under control. @param maxOffset Size of buffer under control.
